{{Infobox person | name = T. Rafael Cimino | image = | alt = | caption = T. Rafael Cimino in [[North Carolina]] | birth_name = Todd Rafael Cimino | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1963|6|4}} | birth_place = [[Wayne, New Jersey]], USA | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Death-date and age|death date†|birth date†}} --> | death_place = | nationality = American | other_names = | occupation = Novelist, screenwriter | spouse = Svetlina Kiryakova (m. 2010) | agent = [[International Creative Management]] | children = Stephanie Nichole Cimino (b, 1987) }} '''Todd Rafael Cimino''' (born June 4, 1963) is an American novelist and screenwriter with credits in both film and television.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2576176/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1|title=T. Rafael Cimino|publisher=IMDb.com|accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> He was born in [[Wayne, New Jersey]], and grew up in the [[Florida Keys]]. He is currently a principal writer with Akula Films<ref>http://variety411.com/biz/t-rafael-cimino/4051711/</ref><ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.aihitdata.com/company/0093B1D7/AKULA-MEDIA-GROUP/people |title=Akula Media Group - Key People |publisher=Aihitdata.com |date= |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> and a consulting producer with [[HBO]].<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://pro-labs.imdb.com/name/nm2576176?rf=cons_nm_contact&ref_=cons_nm_contact |title=T. Rafael Cimino - IMDbPro |publisher=Pro-labs.imdb.com |date=2014-06-06 |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref>
==Film and television== Cimino's work in film and television includes: *''Spring Break'' (1983), Marine Coordinator for the film about a group of college coeds on spring break in [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]].<ref>https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004BA527Q</ref> *''[[Miami Vice]]'' (1984–1990),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.crimetv.com/page/tv/action/miami-vice/663 |title=Miami Vice |publisher=Crimetv.com |date= |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> Marine Coordinator for the television series ''Miami Vice''. His work appeared in 104 episodes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chriscraftstingers.com/history.html |title=History |publisher=Chris-Craft Stingers |date= |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> *''[[Lost in Translation (film)|Lost In Translation]]'' (2003), Contributing writer and associate producer for the film starring [[Bill Murray]] and [[Scarlett Johansson]].<ref>https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/3275595.T_Rafael_Cimino</ref> *''[[Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip]]'' (2006–2007), He was contributing writer for the television series created by [[Aaron Sorkin]], starring [[Matthew Perry]], [[Bradley Whitford]], and [[Amanda Peet]]. His work appeared in 19 episodes.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0485842/combined</ref> *''Miami Vice'' (2006), Consulting Producer and technical advisor for the re-make film of the classic television series of the same name, created by [[Anthony Yerkovich]] and produced by [[Michael Mann (director)|Michael Mann]]. *''Black Dahlia'' (2007), Executive Producer and Writer - Character Arc, Scarlett Johansson for the film, directed by [[Brian De Palma]] and starring Johansson, [[Josh Hartnet]], and [[Aaron Eckhart]].<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0VKRC82Jim0</ref> *''[[The Other Boleyn Girl]]'' (2007), Producer, Story Editor and Arc Writer for the film starring [[Scarlett Johansson]], [[Eric Bana]], and [[Natalie Portman]].{{citation needed|date=January 2016}} *''[[Real Time with Bill Maher]]'' (2012–2014), Staff Writer for the [[HBO]] political round table television program.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3447010/fullcredits?ref_=tt_cl_sm#cast</ref> The show addresses current events with a comical slant. [[Bill Maher]] is a famed stand up comedian and political commentator. *''Gangsters; America's Most Evil'' episode "Los Muchachos" (2013), He appeared as himself in this episode, which depicted the rise and fall of legendary Miami [[Drug lord|drug king pins]] Augusto Falcon and Salvador Magluta. *''The King Of Offshore'' (2014), Appeared as himself in this made-for-TV documentary film about offshore powerboat racer and boat builder Reggie Fountain. The program aired on the NBC Sports Network. *''Summer Crossing'' (Pre-Production) Co-writer with Tristine Skyler.<ref>https://movielala.com/movies/summer-crossing/casts</ref> Based in the Novela by [[Truman Capote]]. "Summer Crossing" marks the directorial debut for Scarlett Johannson. Actress [[Emma Watson]] has been rumored to have been offered the lead role.<ref>http://upandcomers.net/2013/10/08/emma-watson-scarlett-johansson-summer-crossing/</ref> *''Ghost in the Shell'' (2017) Story editor and character arc writer for the Dreamworks / Paramount epic, live action version of the Anime classic. "Ghost in the Shell" is due in theaters Spring of 2017. *''Big Little Lies'' (2017, 18)(Season two, Filming) Consulting Producer for the HBO limited series and second season starring [[Reese Witherspoon]], [[Nicole Kidman]], [[Laura Dern]], [[Shailene Woodley]] and [[Zoe Kravitz]].<ref>https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3920596/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1</ref> *''Dark Age'' (2018)(Filming)Producer, Writer, Political Contributor for the HBO Documentary detailing the declining status of minority schools in the wake of [[Betsy Devos]] and the Presidential Administration of [[Donald J. Trump]].
==Publishing== Cimino authored or co-authored multiple books, including: *''Mid Ocean'' (2009), a novel about drug smugglers and the federal agents who chase them. It is set in the [[Florida Keys]] in the mid 1980s<ref>{{Cite book|title=Mid Ocean: T. Rafael Cimino: 9780615305738: Amazon.com: Books |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |asin = 0615305733}}</ref> and was listed as one of the top 20 novels to read before being made into a film.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mejia |first=Lisette |url=http://www.popsugar.com.au/celebrity/Books-Being-Made-Movies-2012-2013-26459632#photo-26459620 |title=Books Being Made Into Movies in 2012 and 2013 | POPSUGAR Celebrity Australia |publisher=Popsugar.com.au |date= |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> *''Table 21'' (2011), a fictional story set at the turn of the millennium in New York City, involving the relationship between an underworld crime boss and an A-list television celebrity. ''Table 21'' was later re-released as ''The Heir Apparent'' (2015), featuring 11,000 additional words and an alternative ending.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.trcimino.com/index.php/layout/the-heir-apparent |title=The Heir Apparent |publisher=Trcimino.com |date= |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> In 2011 was produced as a major motion picture entitled "Table No. 21" and was directed by Bollywood veteran [[Aditya Datt]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.netflixhd.net/table-no-21-2013-sn2229842/ |title=Table No. 21 (2013) [SN:2229842 |publisher=Netflix HD |date= |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> *''Heavy'' (2014), the sequel to ''Mid Ocean'', co-written with [[George Jung]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tmz.com/2014/06/06/blow-george-jung-sequel-book-heavy/ |title=George Jung Wrote 'Blow' Sequel in Jail |publisher=TMZ.com |date=2014-06-06 |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> who was the subject of the biopic ''[[Blow (film)|Blow]]''. (2001),<ref>{{cite web|last=Simunek |first=Chris |url=http://www.hightimes.com/read/high-times-interview-george-jung |title=The HIGH TIMES Interview: George Jung |publisher=High Times |date=2015-08-05 |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> Parts of ''Heavy'' take place on [[Norman's Cay]] in the Bahamas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.triposo.com/loc/Norman27s_Cay |title=Norman's Cay |publisher=Triposo.com |date= |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref> In June 2015, it was announced that a movie deal to adapt ''Heavy'' had been struck with [[Denis Leary]] and Apostle Films.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2015/06/03/book-movie-heavy-tobin-akula-new-life-mark-one-year-anniversary-of-ex-cocaine-kingpin-george-jungs-release-from-prison/ |title=Book, Movie Deal Mark One-Year Anniversary Of Ex-Cocaine Kingpin George Jung’s Release From Prison « CBS San Francisco |publisher=Sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com |date=2015-06-03 |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref>
==Political activism== While a registered Independent, Cimino sides with progressive issues. He has served as an executive member of the American Civil Liberties Union,<ref>https://www.aclu.org/blog-feed/editors-picks</ref> a supporting member of the Southern Poverty Law Center<ref>https://www.splcenter.org/resources/law-enforcement-resources</ref> and a Professional Member of the National Lawyer's Guild.<ref>https://www.nlg.org/referral-directory/</ref> In 2008, Cimino worked with the campaign to elect Barack Obama, President of the United States, serving as a senior member and advisor to the then candidate's committee for Healthcare Policy Development. The committee was chaired by Zeke Emanuel, architect of the Affordable Care Act, also known as "Obamacare."<ref>https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/screenwriting-wisdom-w-t-rafael-cimino-on-career-in/id923535119?i=1000393763551&mt=2</ref>
In 2012 Cimino joined the HBO production of the political round table, "Real Time with Bill Maher." Today he's a frequent political contributor to CNN.
==Personal life== Cimino was born in Wayne, New Jersey, the son of Peter Cimino, a general practice physician.<ref>https://health.usnews.com/doctors/peter-cimino-304512</ref> At age six his family moved to Key Largo in the Florida Keys. He attended Key Largo Elementary School and the Island Christian School until graduation from high school in 1981. He would go on to attend the University of Florida, Florida Atlantic University and Georgetown University Law School.
While filming "Black Dahlia" in Sofia Bulgaria, he was introduced to Bulgarian National Ballet Dancer, Svetlina Kiryakova by Bulgarian composer Magga Aliev. The two were married in 2010.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2576176/bio?ref_=nm_dyk_trv_sm#trivia</ref>
Cimino has been open about growing up and living with [[Asperger syndrome]].<ref>http://www.coultervideo.com/#!Screenwriter-T-Rafael-Cimino-and-Asperger-Syndrome/cw9s/DD23DADD-6249-4360-BCD9-CEF792A6C643</ref>
Cimino is the nephew of the late Writer/ Director [[Michael Cimino]].<ref>http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/michael-cimino-dead-deer-hunter-908188</ref><ref>http://www.tmz.com/2014/06/06/blow-george-jung-sequel-book-heavy/</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fashiontimes.com/articles/8170/20140606/johnny-depps-blow-sequel-already-written-jail-george-jung.htm |title=Johnny Depp's 'Blow' Sequel Already Written in Jail: George Jung : Trending News |publisher=Fashion Times |date=2014-06-06 |accessdate=2015-09-05}}</ref>

[[Grant Wilson]] | merger = | focus = Paranormal investigating | location = | region = Worldwide | membership = | membership_year = | secessions = | budget_year = | staff = 28 | staff_year = 2015 | volunteers_year = | website = {{URL|www.the-atlantic-paranormal-society.com/}} }} {{Paranormal}} '''The Atlantic Paranormal Society''' ('''TAPS''') is an organization that investigates reported [[paranormal]] activity. Based in [[Warwick, Rhode Island]], TAPS was founded in 1990 by [[Jason Hawes]] and [[Grant Wilson]]. In 2004, the organization itself became the subject of ''[[Ghost Hunters (TV series)|Ghost Hunters]]'', a popular weekly American [[paranormal TV|paranormal]] [[reality TV|reality]] [[television series]] on the [[Syfy]] channel. The show ran for eleven seasons on Syfy in the US. The show aired in the UK nine months after the US premier on ''Living It''. ==History and objectives== In 1990, Hawes began the "Rhode Island Paranormal Society", after having a personal experience with spirits. After RIPS began investigating cases throughout the New England area, Jason met up with Grant Wilson in 1995 and renamed it "The Atlantic Paranormal Society." Wilson had also had a personal experience. Neither man talks about it in public.{{cite web|url=http://basinpark.com/photogallery/basindisplay/pic_details.php?pid=295&size=1|last=Rohrbach|first=Jill M.|title=On Sci Fi Channel's Ghost Hunters Episode|date=July 26, 2005|publisher=Eureka! Historic Hotels|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928065411/http://basinpark.com/photogallery/basindisplay/pic_details.php?pid=295&size=1|archivedate=September 28, 2007|accessdate=October 24, 2013}}{{cite book|title=Ghost Hunting: True Stories of Unexplained Phenomena from The Atlantic Paranormal Society|year=2007|last1=Hawes|first1=Jason|authorlink1=Jason Hawes|last2=Wilson|first2=Grant|authorlink2=Grant Wilson|last3=Friedman|first3=Michael Jan|authorlink3=Michael Jan Friedman|publisher=[[Pocket Books]]|location=[[New York City|New York]]|isbn=978-1-4165-4113-4|lccn=2007016062|pages=2–6}} The group was originally run out of Jason's basement, and at that time consisted only of Jason and Grant.''Ghost Hunting'' (Hawes, Wilson and Friedman), p. 261. They pioneered investigative techniques that many other paranormal investigators use. In 2003 they were approached by Pilgrim Films and taped ten episodes of "Ghost Hunters" for the Sci Fi (now SyFy) channel. ==Media== ===Books=== Starting in 2007, Jason and Grant began releasing a series of books related to their work and experiences in the paranormal as well as several fiction books. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Para Magazine|url=http://www.the-atlantic-paranormal-society.com/paramag.htm|website=The Atlantic Paranormal Society|accessdate=19 March 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060115025645/http://www.the-atlantic-paranormal-society.com/paramag.htm|archivedate=16 January 2006}} | finaldate = | finalnumber = | company = | country = United States | based = [[Fall River, MA]] | language = English | website = {{URL|www.tapsparamag.com}} | issn = | oclc = }} TAPS publishes a bi-monthly publication called ''TAPS Paramagazine'' (also known as ''TAPS Para Mag''), which features articles written by group members and information pertaining to the paranormal. Hawes stated in an interview on the skeptical podcast 'Audiomartini' that the magazine is marketed primarily in an attempt to "fund the TAPS operation."[http://audiomartini.podshowcreator.com/ Audiomartini...Paranormal Radio with a Twist] The magazine itself states that "TAPS Para Magazine is a financial sponsor of The Atlantic Paranormal Society." The average issue is approximately 39 pages in length and in 2006 was marketed by offering a [[making-of|behind-the-scenes]] [[DVD]] of the show to new subscribers. ===Radio show and podcast=== In April 2007, Beyond Reality Radio, a [[radio talk show]] that featured TAPS co-founders and ''[[Ghost Hunters (TV series)|Ghost Hunters]]'' stars [[Jason Hawes]] and [[Grant Wilson]], began broadcasting on select radio stations in the New England area.{{cite web|last1=Allison|first1=Andrea|title=Beyond Reality Radio|url=http://paranormalstories.blogspot.com/2007/04/beyond-reality-radio.html|website=Ghost Stories|accessdate=18 March 2015|date=April 2007}} Airing Saturday nights from 7-10 PM, Jason and Grant interviewed guests about the Paranormal and allowed listeners to call in to contribute to the discussion. The show was produced by [[Amy Bruni]], with help from Dave Gardiner. During the show listeners could visit the official TAPS website and chat about the show or any other subjects in a moderated chat room. The show is currently on [[hiatus (television)|hiatus]] and no date has been given for its return. In July 2006 TAPS began releasing podcasts, ''TAPS Para-Radio'', featuring Hawes and Wilson, on a sporadic basis. ===Video game=== On December 1, 2007, TAPS released a [[video game]] in conjunction with [[Star Mountain Studios]] called ''Apparitions: Red Reef Inn''. Available online for PC & Mac, TAPS co-founder Grant Wilson claims that this game is just the start of larger efforts in the interactive media space from TAPS in the future. In January 2010 TAPS and Star Mountain Studios released a hidden object game entitled ''Apparitions: Kotsmine Hills''.{{cite web|url=http://www.starmountainstudios.com/apparitions/|title=''Apparitions'' game community|publisher=|accessdate=5 October 2014}} ==Methods== TAPS sends a group of 3 to 8 members to perform an 8- to 16-hour investigation, covering multiple nights, employing a number of [[infrared]] and digital video cameras, [[thermal camera]] devices, EMF (electromagnetic field) [[EMF meter|detector]]s, digital [[thermometer]]s and other equipment throughout the site in question. While at a site, the members of the team often find common explanations for the claims of the occupants. In conclusion, the team will report on its findings, and express their opinion that a site is "[[wiktionary:haunted|haunted]]" or "not haunted." They distinguish themselves from other paranormal groups by going into a case by claiming they wish to disprove a haunting. TAPS does not charge their clients for the investigations or consulting. ==Criticism== {{Main article|Ghost Hunters (TV series)#Criticism}} According to investigator [[Benjamin Radford]] most ghost hunting groups including TAPS make many methodological mistakes. "After watching episodes of ''[[Ghost Hunters (TV series)|Ghost Hunters]]'' and other similar programs, it quickly becomes clear to anyone with a background in science that the methods used are both illogical and unscientific". Anyone can be a ghost investigator, "failing to consider alternative explanations for anomalous ... phenomena", considering emotions and feelings as "evidence of ghostly encounters". "Improper and unscientific investigation methods" for example "using unproven tools and equipment", "sampling errors", "ineffectively using recording devices" and "focusing on the history of the location...and not the phenomena". In his article for ''[[Skeptical Inquirer]]'' Radford concludes that ghost hunters should care about doing a truly scientific investigation: "I believe that if ghosts exist, they are important and deserve to be taken seriously. Most of the efforts to investigate ghosts so far have been badly flawed and unscientific --- and, not surprisingly, fruitless."{{cite journal|last1=Radford|first1=Benjamin|title=Ghost-Hunting Mistakes: Science and Pseudoscience in Ghost Investigations|journal=[[Skeptical Inquirer]]|date=November 2010|volume=34.6|issue=5|pages=44–46|url=http://www.csicop.org/si/show/ghost-hunting_mistakes_science_and_pseudoscience_in_ghost_investigations/|accessdate=19 March 2015|location=Buffalo, NY|issn=0194-6730|oclc=470205411}} ==Non-profit status issues== In 2006, a website called "SAPS" ("Skeptical Analysis of the Paranormal Society") conducted an investigation into the status and legitimacy of the TAPS [[Nonprofit organization|non-profit]] status. In several places on their website it stated that they were non-profit and did investigations free of charge, however did accept donations and held a raffle to win various branded merchandise. The site claimed that repeated attempts to clarify the subject was met with negative responses. It broadened its investigation by searching for its status both federally and at the state level and found no evidence that they were a registered non-profit organization. They also found that the raffle was in violation of the state's gambling laws as it allowed those that could be under the age of 18 to participate.{{cite web|last1=Smith|first1=Alison|title=The Atlantic Paranormal Society|url=http://remievandeross.tripod.com/reports/ghosts/taps.html|website=SAPS|accessdate=19 March 2015|date=2006}} In February 2007, TAPS issued a statement regarding the status. It stated that they, "...by no means meant to give the appearance that we had non-profit status. By this, we meant that we do not make any profit at all from investigating. We couldn't simply say 'TAPS makes no money whatsoever' because TAPS does gather meager funds from the occasional donation and membership dues. The money that comes in does NOT come from the client in direct relation to a case, nor does it go into anyone's pocket. So, therefore we used the term non-profit."{{cite web|title=TAPS as Non-Profit|url=http://www.the-atlantic-paranormal-society.com/nonprofit.html|website=The Atlantic Paranormal Society|accessdate=19 March 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070208091407/http://www.the-atlantic-paranormal-society.com/nonprofit.html|archivedate=8 February 2007}} They have since changed non-profit to "free volunteer organization" to clear up any misconceptions and have been working on filing for the appropriate status but claim that it is very difficult for a paranormal group to do in [[Rhode Island]]. ==Notable members== Members of TAPS can be found worldwide. TAPS has also made honorary members of some celebrities who have participated in investigations filmed for the ''Ghost Hunters'' TV series, several of whom, such as Tapping and The Miz, appear in programming produced by the show's parent network, [[Syfy]]. They include the following people. * [[Jodi Picoult]] - Tag along Member (1996) * [[CM Punk]] - Honorary Member (2006) * [[Elijah Burke]] - Honorary Member (2007) * [[Mike Mizanin|The Miz]] - Honorary Member (2008) * [[Amanda Tapping]] - Honorary Member (2008) * [[Colin Ferguson (actor)|Colin Ferguson]] - Honorary Member (2008) * [[Meat Loaf]] - Honorary Member (2009) * [[Kofi Kingston]] - Honorary Member (2010) * [[Joe Maddalena]] – Honorary Member (2010) * [[Meaghan Rath]] – Honorary Member (2010) * [[Allison Scagliotti]] – Honorary Member (2010) ==TAPS Family networking== Many paranormal investigation groups network and assist similar member groups across the nation and around the world. TAPS invites paranormal research organizations into its own network, and may refer cases to them. These organizations are part of a network called the '''TAPS Family'''. Member organizations put a "TAPS Family Member" banner on their websites, which link to The Atlantic Paranormal Society's web page.
